predicate.note: Frames file for 'work' based on Chris' existing file and survey of initial sentences of big corpus. Substantial changes from Chris' system, which made no sense anyway.

roleset.name: work
roleset.note: Beware of usages like "put the taggers to work". Treebank calls work a verb in this context, but that is clearly wrong. It will take no argument structure.

example.name: unaccusative with more details
example.text: Ms. Kirkpatrick worked in Tokyo for three years.

example.name: job
example.text: Mr. Cray has been working on the project for more than six years.

example.name: odd job variant
example.text: 33 men worked closely with the substance.

example.name: employer and job
example.text: Mr. Cray will work for the Colorado Springs CO company as an independent contractor.

example.name: with coworker, predicative job
example.text: He will work with his successor to ensure a smooth transition.

example.name: work = cause, create
example.text: In addition to his interest in ozone depletion he has extensively studied the related topic of global warming, a theory that mankind's generation of carbon dioxide through increased combustion of fossil fuels is creating a ``greenhouse effect'' that [*T*-1] will work important climatic changes in the earth's atmosphere over time.

example.name: missing desctination
example.text: The curator, 27-year-old Sherman Krisher of Greenwich, Conn., had worked his way up from janitor in seven years at the museum.
example.arg: The curator, 27-year-old Sherman Krisher of Greenwich, Conn.,
in seven years at the museum

example.name: filthy capitalism
example.text: And by basing donations on BK Doubles, a new double-hamburger line the fast-food chain is trying to push, Burger King works a sales pitch into its public-service message.
example.arg: by basing donations on BK Doubles, a new double-hamburger line the fast-food chain is trying to push

example.name: mistaken etymologizing
example.text: It may seem trivial to worry about the World Series amid the destruction to the Bay Area wrought [*] by Tuesday's quake, but the name of this column is ``On Sports,'' so I feel obliged to do so.
example.rel: [*] -> the destruction to the Bay Area
example.note: This is fascinating: wrought is the proper passive participle to work, but this usage is clearly using it as the passive of wreak; the 'proper' passive of wreak is wreaked. Now I wonder where else wrought is showing up.

example.name: scheme
example.text: The company will work out a plan to pay its debts.
example.arg: a plan to pay its debts

example.name: collaborators
example.text: The details haven't been worked out between the Seattle aerospace company and Kawasaki Heavy Industries, Ltd.
example.arg: the Seattle aerospace company and Kawasaki Heavy Industries, Ltd.

example.name: nicely unaccusative
example.text: ``Things work out unexpectedly in life,'' said Ms. Volokh.

example.name: little girly man
example.text: John works out daily with weights.

example.name: work it out
example.text: But Mr. Achenbaum pioneered negotiated fees, which *trace* often worked out to less than 15%.

example.name: with agent
example.text: (No one has worked out the players' average age, but most appear to be in their late 30s.)

roleset.name: work up: create, cause to come about

example.name: back to exercise
example.text: They have worked up a sweat.

example.name: with benefactive
example.text: The decision in Los Angeles federal court stems from a 1985 Mercury Sable TV ad that Young & Rubicam worked *trace* up for Ford Motor Co.
